com.github.ffalcinelli.jdivert

Class Packet

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.ffalcinelli.jdivert.Packet

  • public class Packet
extends java.lang.Object
    A single packet, possibly including an Ip header, a Tcp/Udp header and a payload.

    Creation of packets is cheap, attributes are parsed when accessing them.

    Created by fabio on 21/10/2016.

    • Constructor Summary

      • Packet

        public Packet(byte[] raw,
              WinDivertAddress addr)
        Construct a Packet from the given byte array and for the given WinDivertAddress metadata.
        Parameters:
        raw - The packet's array of bytes.
        addr - The metadata (interface and direction).

      • Packet

        public Packet(byte[] raw,
              int[] iface,
              Enums.Direction direction)
        Construct a Packet from the given byte array and for the given metadata.
        Parameters:
        raw - The packet's array of bytes.
        iface - The interface in form of {InterfaceIndex, InterfaceSubIndex} integer pair.
        direction - The Direction.

        public boolean isLoopback()
        Indicates if the packet is on the loopback interface.
        Returns:
        True, if the packet is on the loopback interface, false otherwise.

      • setSrcPort

        public void setSrcPort(int port)
        Convenience method to set the source port number.
        Parameters:
        port - The port number to set for source service. If packet does not have such info an IllegalStateException is thrown.

        Convenience method to set the destination port number.

      • recalculateChecksum

        public void recalculateChecksum(Enums.CalcChecksumsOption... options)
                         throws WinDivertException
        Recalculates the checksum fields matching the given options.
        Parameters:
        options - Drive the recalculateChecksum function.
        Throws:
        WinDivertException - Whenever the DLL call sets a LastError different by 0 (Success) or 997 (Overlapped I/O is in progress).

      • getWinDivertAddress

        public WinDivertAddress getWinDivertAddress()
        Put the Packet metadata into a WinDivertAddress structure.
        Returns:
        The WinDivertAddress representing the packet metadata.
